name: The Bart Simpson Quiz #3 | 'Simpsons' - Characters | 10 Questions

questions.text: In "Bart's Girlfriend", Bart and the minister's daughter Jessica skateboard down a really steep hill.  A truck crashes and covers Bart in what at the bottom of the hill?
questions.explanation:
Glue.

	He slips down the hill on oil, and passes the glue truck, but no glue spilled out.  He hits a nut on the road and falls, and someone calls out that the glue finally did spill.

questions.text: The name that Bart pasted to Principal Skinner's weather balloon in "Bart's Comet" was Buttzilla.
questions.explanation:
False.

	It says "Big Butt Skinner" on the actual weather balloon, but Bart has pictures of himself making the dummy with an alternate title, "Buttzilla".

questions.text: When Bart is targeted in Australia for fraud, what animal does he bring with him Down Under?
questions.explanation:
Bullfrog.

	He leaves his bullfrog at a fountain at the airport, but it escapes  and breeds all over Australia.  The Simpsons unknowingly bring a koala to America as they pass over fields of bullfrogs in their helicopter.

questions.text: Bart creates a posse to go to what town in order to save Springfield's lemon tree in "Lemon of Troy"?
questions.explanation:
Shelbyville.

	Shelbyville is basically a mirror image of Springfield because it has characters who act and look like the citizens of Springfield.  Bart has his friends join together to defeat the Shelbyvillians and bring back Springfield's lemon tree.

questions.text: Bart loses a movie role to Milhouse for playing what character in the Radioactive Man Movie?
questions.explanation:
Fallout Boy.

	Radioactive Man was played by Ranier Wolfcastle.  Milhouse begins to hate movie stardom while Bart wishes he played the role.

questions.text: How much does Bart sell his soul to Milhouse for in "Bart Sells his Soul"?
questions.explanation:
Five dollars.

	Milhouse soon sells Bart's soul to Comic Book Guy for Alf pogs.  Lisa then buys Bart's soul with money from her piggy bank, and everything goes back to normal.

questions.text: In "Bart on the Road", who doesn't accompany Bart on the trip to Knoxville?
questions.explanation:
Ralph.

	Bart creates a fake ID when he's at the DMV with Patty and Selma and he goes on a road trip to Knoxville.  He ends up crushing the car under Knoxville's World Fair Sunsphere (now known as the Wigsphere) and the group has to fly home.

questions.text: What is the name of Bart's twin in the Halloween vignette "The Thing and I"?
questions.explanation:
Hugo.

	Marge and Homer had been keeping Hugo in the attic for ten years feeding him fish heads until Bart and Lisa investigate.  It turned out Bart was actually the evil twin, so they had to switch places.

questions.text: Bart is in all of the vignettes of "Treehouse of Horror VIII".
questions.explanation:
True.

	The vignettes include "The Homega Man", "Fly vs. Fly", and "Easy Bake Coven".  In "Fly vs. Fly", Bart switches bodies with a fly using a matter transporter.

questions.text: Whose car does Bart crash in "Bart Carny"?
questions.explanation:
Hitler's.

	At the Springfield Carnival, Bart crashes Hitler's car, and he has to pay off his debt by working at the carnival with Homer.
